name: Complete Blood Count
description: A common blood test that evaluates overall health and detects a wide range of disorders.

name: Blood Culture
description: A test to detect bacteria or other organisms in the blood.

name: Stool Culture
description: A test to detect the presence of disease-causing bacteria, viruses, or parasites in the stool.

name: Widal Test
description: A serological test used to diagnose enteric fever or typhoid fever.

name: Chest X-ray
description: An imaging test to view the structures inside the chest, particularly the lungs.

name: Pulmonary Function Test
description: A test to measure how well the lungs are functioning.

name: Electrocardiogram
description: A test that records the electrical activity of the heart.

name: Urinalysis
description: A test of urine to detect and manage various disorders.

name: Liver Function Test
description: A group of blood tests that give information about the state of a patient's liver.

name: Kidney Function Test
description: A test to check how well the kidneys are working.
